results.title: Khmer! Khmer!: Cambodia in conflict (D)
results.creator_credit: James G. Gerrand, ABC and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: Portrays the life, culture, history and politics of the Cambodians. Focuses on Norodom Sihanouk’s abdication from the throne and becoming the first Democratic Leader of Cambodia, thus destroying the old feudal system and through to social and political destruction during the Vietnam War. Narrated by Richard Oxenburgh. WARNING: Contains graphic scenes of war related deaths.

results.title: Kampuchea: the long road back
results.creator_credit: John Wall, Leonard Teale and Canterbury Productions
results.brief_description: Commissioned by the sponsors of the Kampuchean Relief Appeal this made for television documentary shows how donations to International Relief Aid were used to bring aid to Kampuchea. Also records the plight of Kampucheans still struggling for survival after the death and destruction caused by the Pol Pot regime. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Soft soap
results.brief_description: Antics of Peter and Harry, two dedicated but “out of tune” artists who devote their time obsessively to recreating the characters of Harlequin and Pierrot. Designed to draw attention to the insidious ways in which advertising techniques manipulate the consumer in the market place. Shot in Melbourne. Stars Max Gillies and Joe Bolza.

results.title: Casting iron plow-shares
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
This film presents Tajik men of Afghanistan performing the several stages that shape, mould and cast, in wet sands, their iron plow-shares. It explains how over the centuries this ancient craft has achieved economy of action and perfect timing. No narration - traditional music accompaniament. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Shearing Yaks (Tajik People)
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
Explains how the yak herds, which stay high in the mountains, where it is cool, are brought down to the village for shearing. The wool is pounded by men with sticks, spun into yarn and kept until there is enough to make a carpet. Shows the Tajik people shearing yaks.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Communication without speech
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Recent advances in technology have enabled the development of a range of sophisticated communication devices which, with the assistance of microprocessors, enables students with severe communication impairment to communicate, using voice and print.

results.title: My nightmare has just begun
results.creator_credit: Linda Lord, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Lord recounts the day the Gippsland bushfires came to her home. Despite undergoing fire training and preparation, when the fire front approached, there was no time to think. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
